alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:29AM EST until January 10 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Chester Creek Near Chester affecting Delaware County. For the Chester Creek...including Chester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chester Creek near Chester. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The creek floods adjacent open land. At 10.5 feet, Flood damage, adjacent to the creek, begins in the city of Chester. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:16 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.9 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:16 AM EST Wednesday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 3.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 03/13/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (unknown Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 Stg Time Date Chester Creek Chester 8.0 9.9 Wed 4 am MSG MSG Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 900 AM EST.
